com.xceptance.xlt.visualassertion.util

Class ImageHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xceptance.xlt.visualassertion.util.ImageHelper

  • public class ImageHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Util class which provides the necessary function to manipulate and create images for the comparison algorithms.

        Returns:

      • calculatePixelRGBDiff

        protected static double calculatePixelRGBDiff(int rgb1,
                                              int rgb2)
        The method weights the red, green and blue values and determines the difference as humans would see it. Based on a comparison algorithm from http://www.compuphase.com/cmetric.htm . The algorithm is based on experiments with people, not theoretics. It is thereby not certain.
        Parameters:
        rgb1 - color number 1
        rgb2 - color number 2
        Returns:
        the difference between the colors as percent from 0.0 to 1.0

      • calcBlockLength

        protected static int calcBlockLength(int axisPixelCount,
                                     int n,
                                     int imageSpan)
        Calculates whether the current block exceeds either the x or y coordinates of the image. Checks one axis of the image at a time.
        Parameters:
        axisPixelCount - The number of pixels in this block for axis that should be checked
        n - index of the current block
        imageSpan - the width/ height of the image
        Returns:
        The number of pixels that can be used for the mask either in the x or y axis

      • compareImages

        protected static java.awt.Point[] compareImages(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img1,
                                                java.awt.image.BufferedImage img2)
        Exact pixel by pixel compare. Images must have the same size
        Parameters:
        img1 - First image for the comparison
        img2 - Second image for the comparison
        Returns:
        Point[] array that contains the coordinates of pixels that are different

      • colorFuzzyCompare

        protected static java.awt.Point[] colorFuzzyCompare(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img1,
                                                    java.awt.image.BufferedImage img2,
                                                    double colorTolerance)
        Method for the color based comparison of pixels. The method compares pixel by pixel with a threshold for the difference in color. Small deviations are permitted.
        Parameters:
        img1 - The first image for the comparison
        img2 - The second image for the comparison
        colorTolerance - A threshold value that calculates the allowed difference in color between two pixels [0-1[
        Returns:
        Point[] array that contains the coordinates of pixels that are different

      • fuzzyCompare

        protected static java.awt.Point[] fuzzyCompare(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img1,
                                               java.awt.image.BufferedImage img2,
                                               double colorTolerance,
                                               double pixelTolerance,
                                               int fuzzyBlockDimension)
        Compares two images by partitioning them into blocks and checking the number of different pixels in each block. Therefore the difference in color with the given color threshold is calculated. If the number of pixels that are found as different in one block exceeds a number threshold the images are treated as differently and the pixel coordinates are saved as Point objects.
        Parameters:
        img1 - The first image for the comparison
        img2 - The second image for the comparison
        colorTolerance - A threshold value that calculates the allowed difference in color between two pixels [0-1[
        pixelTolerance - A threshold value that calculates the allowed number of different pixels per block [0-1[
        fuzzyBlockDimension - The x and y dimension d of one block of pixels(d*d), which are validated together
        Returns:
        Point[] array that contains the coordinates of pixels that are different

      • scaleDownMaskImage

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage scaleDownMaskImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                                 int newWidth,
                                                                 int newHeight,
                                                                 int scalingFactor,
                                                                 int rgbForegroundColor)
        Scales a binary image down to the given size. Does not innately preserve Width/ Height ratio. Used in closeImage. Divides the bigger image into blocks. If there are some pixels leftover, the last blocks gets them, no matter how many they are. It sets a pixel to the foreground color if any any pixel in the corresponding block had the foreground color.
        Parameters:
        img - The original image
        newWidth - The width of the new image after scaling
        newHeight - The height of the new image after scaling
        scalingFactor - The scaling factor for the image size
        rgbForegroundColor - The foreground color
        Returns:
        A downscaled BufferedImage copy of the original image

      • scaleUpMaskImage

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage scaleUpMaskImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                               int newWidth,
                                                               int newHeight,
                                                               int scalingFactor,
                                                               int rgbForegroundColor)
        Scales a binary image up to the given size. Does not innately preserve Width/ Height ratio. Used in closeImage. Divides the bigger image into blocks. Sets all the pixels in the block to the foreground color if the corresponding pixel has the foreground color. If there are some pixels leftover, the last blocks gets them, no matter how many there are.
        Parameters:
        img - The original image
        newWidth - The width of the new image after scaling
        newHeight - The height of the new image after scaling
        scalingFactor - The scaling factor for the image size
        rgbForegroundColor - The foreground color
        Returns:
        A upscaled BufferedImage copy of the original image

      • increaseImageSize

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage increaseImageSize(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                                int width,
                                                                int height)
        Increases an images width and height, the old image will be in the top left corner of the new image; the rest will be transparent black
        Parameters:
        img - The original image
        width - The width of the new image
        height - The height of the new image
        Returns:
        A new BufferedImage that holds the original image in the top left corner and the rest is filled with black

      • adaptImageSize

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage adaptImageSize(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                             int width,
                                                             int height)
        Creates a new image with a changed image size if it doesn't match the given width and height
        Parameters:
        img - The original image
        width - The width that the image should have
        height - The height that the image should have
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage copy of the original image that has been adjusted to the given width and height

      • overlayMaskImage

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage overlayMaskImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                               java.awt.image.BufferedImage overlay,
                                                               int rgbForegroundColor)
        Overlays the black areas of one image over another image. Doesn't actually use transparency.
        Parameters:
        image - The original image
        overlay - the image that will be placed over the original image
        rgbForegroundColor - The color that is used for the originally black areas
        Returns:
        A BufferedImage copy of the original image in which the black areas of the overlay are marked

      • erodeImage

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage erodeImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                         int structElementWidth,
                                                         int structElementHeight,
                                                         int rgbForegroundColor,
                                                         int rgbBackgroundColor)
        Creates and returns an erosion image, using the algorithm from morphological image processing.

        Assumes the structuring element is filled with ones and thereby only needs it's width and height. The origin is placed in the middle of the structuring element. If width and/ or height are even, they are incremented to make sure there is a middle pixel.

        Parameters:
        img - the image to erode
        structElementWidth - Width of the structure element mask
        structElementHeight - Height of the structure element mask
        rgbForegroundColor - Foreground color
        rgbBackgroundColor - Background color
        Returns:
        The eroded image as BufferedImage

      • dilateImage

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage dilateImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                          int structElementWidth,
                                                          int structElementHeight,
                                                          int rgbForegroundColor,
                                                          int rgbBackgroundColor)
        Creates and returns a dilation image using the algorithm for morphological image processing.

        Assumes the structuring element is filled with ones and thereby only needs it's width and height. The origin is placed in the middle of the structuring element. If width and/ or height are even, they are incremented to make sure there is a middle pixel.

        Uses the rgbForegroundColor and rgbBackgroundColor instance variables to determine the background and the foreground color.

        Parameters:
        img - the image to dilate
        structElementWidth - the width of the structure element mask
        structElementHeight - the height of the structure element mask
        rgbForegroundColor - the foreground color
        rgbBackgroundColor - the background color
        Returns:
        the dilated image as BufferedImage

      • closeImage

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage closeImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                         int structElementWidth,
                                                         int structElementHeight,
                                                         int rgbForegroundColor,
                                                         int rgbBackgroundColor)
        Shrinks an image using the shrinkImage method, closes it and scales it back up again for performance reasons. Depending on the images size and the compressionfactor, it may still be very performance heavy. Closes an image using the dilation and erosion methods.
        Parameters:
        img - the image to close
        structElementWidth - the width of the structure element for dilation and erosion
        structElementHeight - the height of the structure element for dilation and erosion
        rgbForegroundColor - The foreground color for the marking
        rgbBackgroundColor - The background color for the marking
        Returns:
        the closed image

      • markDifferencesWithBoxes

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage markDifferencesWithBoxes(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                                       java.awt.Point[] pixels,
                                                                       int markingSizeX,
                                                                       int markingSizeY)
        Method to mark areas around the detected differences. Goes through every pixel that was different and marks the marking block it is in, unless it was marked already.
        If markingX of markingY are 1, it will simply mark the detected differences.
        Parameters:
        image - the original image for which the differences were found
        pixels - the array with the differences.
        markingSizeX - Length of the marker on the x axis
        markingSizeY - Length of the marker on the y axis
        Returns:
        Copy of the original image with marked pixels

      • markDifferencesWithAMarker

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage markDifferencesWithAMarker(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                                                         java.awt.Point[] pixels,
                                                                         int markingSizeX,
                                                                         int markingSizeY)
        Method to mark areas around the detected differences. Goes through every pixel that was different and marks the marking block it is in, unless it was marked already.
        If markingX of markingY are 1, it will simply mark the detected differences.
        Parameters:
        image - the original image for which the differences were found
        pixels - the array with the differences.
        markingSizeX - Length of the marker on the x axis
        markingSizeY - Length of the marker on the y axis
        Returns:
        Copy of the original image with marked pixels

      • colorPixel

        protected static void colorPixel(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                 int x,
                                 int y,
                                 java.awt.Color c)
        Colors a certain pixel using getComplementaryColor. Works directly on imgOut.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the pixel to color
        y - the y coordinate of the pixel to color

      • drawBorders

        protected static void drawBorders(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
                                  int currentX,
                                  int currentY,
                                  int width,
                                  int height,
                                  int subImageWidth,
                                  int subImageHeight,
                                  java.awt.Color c)
        Colors the borders of a certain rectangle. Used to mark blocks. Uses the colorPixel method and subImageHeight/ subImageWidth.
        Works directly on imgOut.
        Parameters:
        image - The image in which something will be marked
        currentX - Starting position
        currentY - Starting position
        width - Vertical length of the rectangle to mark
        height - Horizontal length of the rectangle to mark
        subImageWidth - the width of the partial image
        subImageHeight - the height of the partial image

      • markImageBorders

        protected static java.awt.image.BufferedImage markImageBorders(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                                                               int startW,
                                                               int startH)
        Fully marks the bottom and right borders of an image transparent (transparent white). Used in isEqual to mark the previously not existent parts of an image.
        Parameters:
        img - the image to mark
        startW - the width from which to start marking
        startH - the height from which the marking starts
        Returns:
        the marked image
